themes: Multi-year funding for nonprofit cultural anchors
Leveraging non-arts and federal funding streams
key_phrases: positioning the arts as essential infrastructure
integrate the arts into areas like health, housing, transportation, education, and social services
artist residencies in public health departments
affordable creative space, access to equipment, mentorship, and operational support
long-standing, community-based organizations are being displaced due to rising costs
multi-year funding for NPOs providing a cultural anchor
redefine what arts funding can be (without solely dependent on HOT)
barriers_identified: Displacement of community-based organizations due to rising costs
Dependence on HOT (Hotel Occupancy Tax) funding
Insufficient operational support for artists and organizations
solutions_proposed: Integrate arts into non-cultural city sectors (health, housing, transportation, education, social services)
Launch artist-led programs addressing civic challenges
Pursue federal and non-arts funding streams for creative initiatives
Prioritize affordable creative space through partnerships, subsidies, and policy change
Conduct a citywide site survey of vacant, city-owned properties for cultural activation
Provide multi-year funding for NPOs offering year-round programming and mentorship
